oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of cationic surfactant on the adsorption characteristics of anionic surfactant on cellulose surface
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PARIA, SANTANU
MANOHAR, C
KHILAR, KC
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: adsorption
cellulose derivatives
hydrophobicity
surface reactions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Adsorption kinetics and equilibrium studies of sodium dodecylbenzenesulfonate (NaDBS) on cellulosic surface are investigated. Modifications in adsorption induced by cationic surfactant cetyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB) are studied. It is concluded that the rate of adsorption and the amount of adsorption are increased. Importance of these observations in detergency is indicated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Colloids and Surfaces A: Physicochemical and Engineering Aspects 232(2-3), 139-142
